00035 //
00036 // Predefined slider types (mStyle)
00037 //
00038 #define FRAC_SLIDER 1    // 0.0...1.0
00039 #define DB_SLIDER 2      // -36...36 dB
00040 #define PAN_SLIDER 3     // -1.0...1.0
00041 #define SPEED_SLIDER 4  // 0.01 ..3.0 
00042 
00043 // Customizable slider only: If stepValue is STEP_CONTINUOUS,
00044 // every value on the slider between minValue and maxValue
00045 // will be possible
00046 //
00047 #define STEP_CONTINUOUS 0.0f
00048 
00049 //
00050 // Lightweight slider - i.e. a slider that doesn't appear in
00051 // its own window, but rather draws itself inside an existing
00052 // window (used inside Track Labels).  The ASlider class,
00053 // which uses this class, is below.
00054 //
00055 
00056 class LWSlider

00059    friend class ASliderAx;

00284 // This is a modal dialog that contains an ASlider
00285 // and a text-entry box which can be used to set the
00286 // value of a slider.

00288 {
00289  public:

00291                 const wxString & title,

00295                 float value,
00296                 float line,
00297                 float page);
00298    ~SliderDialog();
00299    
00300    float Get();
00301

00303    bool TransferDataToWindow();
00304    bool TransferDataFromWindow();
00305 
00306    void OnSlider(wxCommandEvent &event);
00307 
00308    ASlider * mSlider;
00309    wxTextCtrl * mTextCtrl;
00310    int mStyle;

00312  public:
00313    DECLARE_EVENT_TABLE()

00317 #if wxUSE_ACCESSIBILITY
00318 
00319 class ASliderAx: public wxWindowAccessible
00320 {
00321 public:
00322    ASliderAx(wxWindow * window);
00323 
00324    virtual ~ ASliderAx();
00325 
00326    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00327    // All objects must support this property.
00328    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00329 
00330    // Gets the number of children.
00331    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00332 
00333    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00334    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00335    // string if there is no action.
00336    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00337    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00338    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00339    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00340 
00341    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00342    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00343 
00344    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00345    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00346    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00347    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00348    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00349 
00350    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00351    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00352 
00353    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00354    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00355    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00356 
00357    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00358    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00359    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00360 
00361    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00362    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00363 
00364    // Returns a role constant.
00365    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00366 
00367    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00368    // of this object.
00369    // Acceptable values:
00370    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00371    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00372    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00373    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00374    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00375    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00376 
00377    // Returns a state constant.
00378    virtual wxAccStatus GetState(int childId, long* state);
00379 
00380    // Returns a localized string representing the value for the object
00381    // or child.
00382    virtual wxAccStatus GetValue(int childId, wxString* strValue);
00383 
00384 };
